result.correct_soap_O:
No objective data is available in transcript.

Imaging:
CT scans showed large bladder tumor.​​​
result.correct_soap_P: Based on the review of CT scans, it is seemed to be likely invasive bladder cancer obstructing left kidney. Based on the large size of the tumor involving one-third of the bladder, I do not think chemotherapy is a curative option. I discussed with patient about proceeding with surgical option of radical cystectomy, which would be the best option at this time. Discussed that it will take about 5-6 hours for surgery followed by a few days of hospitalization. All potential surgical risks and benefits discussed in detail. We will schedule radical cystectomy once patient is decided. Before scheduling radical cystectomy, we will do cystoscopy with biopsy today to figure out final tissue diagnosis. All questions were addressed appropriately and patient verbalized her understanding.
result.correct_soap_S: Patient is here today for cystoscopy with biopsy. Patient with left kidney obstruction and has gross hematuria and she had CT scans done recently that showed large bladder tumor.
